intro: Fremya austrocaledonica, commonly known as the New Caledonian hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the island of New Caledonia. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of red, pink, and white. The plant has palmate leaves with a smooth, waxy surface and thrives in moist, well-drained soils. It is often found in coastal and lowland forest areas, where it plays a role in local ecosystems. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
